newsitem.title: OMAN: Oman, Wimpey, Archirodon in $93mln port deal.
newsitem.headline: Oman, Wimpey, Archirodon in $93mln port deal.

text.p: Oman said it signed a 35 million rial ($93 million) construction deal with units of Britain's Wimpey Plc and the Geneva-based Archirodon to build a quay and terminal facilities at its southern Mina Raysut port.
Oman's Communications Minister Salem bin Abdullah al-Ghazali said in a statement the deal was signed on Monday with local subsidiaries of the two firms -- Wimpey Alawi and Hani Archirodon.

Both firms will over 23 months build the quay and terminal facilities of the new Raysut container port near Salalah, 1,000 km (620 miles) south of Muscat. Two berths will be in operation by August 1998, it said.

Raysut port, now little more than a fishing harbour, is to be dredged to 15 metres to become a container port with a 1.2 km quay wall, four berths and 18 gantry cranes under a multi-million dollar deal, the statement said.
Oman hopes the new Raysut port will establish it as a gateway for container traffic in the Gulf, east Africa and India.
